info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 4 at 3:26AM CDT until June 7 at 9:35PM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Clear Boggy Creek near Caney affecting Atoka County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Clear Boggy Creek near Caney.
* WHEN...Until late Saturday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Creek levels rise to three feet higher than flood stage in western Atoka County and the northeastern edge of Bryan County. High stages on small feeder streams result in even greater depths to mainstem bottomlands near their points of entry into Clear Boggy Creek. Croplands... pastures... and some secondary rural roads are flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 22.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 26.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early this morning to 28.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall just after midnight tonight. It will rise to 28.8 feet again Friday morning before falling back below flood stage Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH
